Package graph.packing

Optimization package that obtains near-optimal solution to the 2-packing combinatorial optimization problem.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
BBNodeComparatorIntf comparator for BBNode2 objects.
 

Class Summary
BBGASPPacker implements a hybrid parallel GASP-Branch&Bound heuristic scheme for the 1- or 2-packing problem in graphs.
BBNodeComparator1 Balanced comparator that mostly takes into account the bound-based estimate for the corresponding BB-node (resembling a Best-First Search), turning into Depth-First Search when the bound estimates are close to each other.
BBNodeComparator2 This comparator is Depth-First-Search in spirit, and only differs from DFS when two solutions are "very similar", in which case, the bound of each soln will be the determinant factor in which soln is examined first.
BBThreadPool wrapper class for the parallel.ParallelAsynchBatchTaskExecutor class.
DefBBNodeComparator an implementation of the BBNodeComparatorIntf.
GASPPacker Implements a GRASP algorithm for the 2-packing problem where however, there is always a "best" free node to select from whenever the set of free nodes is non-empty, thus the name "GASP" instead of "GRASP".
GraphPackingEvalFunction  
GRASPPacker Implements a fast GRASP algorithm for the 1- or 2-packing problem, well-known combinatorial optimization problems.
GRASPPackerIntSetNbrhoodFilter  
GRASPPackerIntSetNbrhoodFilter2  
SetSizeEvalFunction Evaluates the size of the set-argument and returns its negative.
SetWeightEvalFunction Evaluates the total weight of the nodes whose ids are in the set-argument and returns its negative.
SSNode A class implementing the Self-Stabilizing algorithm for finding a maximal 2-packing in a graph.
 

Exception Summary
PackingException Class used to indicate exceptions in the packing package!.
 

Package graph.packing Description

Optimization package that obtains near-optimal solution to the 2-packing combinatorial optimization problem.

Package Specification

Parallel solver that implements a Branch & Bound procedure embedded in a GASP framework (Greedy Adaptive Search Procedure). Local Search is also implemented as part of the standard GRASP procedure (as subclasses of the popt4jlib.LocalSearch package interfaces but the only neighborhoods that can improve upon the solution found by "GRASP without local search" are very time consuming procedures.
  • hyperlink

Related Documentation

S. Vasillaras & I.T. Christou, "On the Optimal Capacity of Mobile Ad-hoc Networks with Finite Nodes", PIMRC 2011, Toronto, Canada. I.T. Christou & S. Vasillaras, "A Parallel Hybrid Branch & Bound GRASP Heuristic for the D2EMIS Problem", Computers & Operations Research, 2012, To Appear.
